title: Prime gaps
content: According to Wikipedia "Prime gap", ~ https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Prime_gap (16-Aug-2020): "A _prime gap_ is the difference between two successive prime numbers. The n-th prime gap, denoted g_n or g(p_n) is the difference between the (n+1)-th and the n-th prime numbers, i.e. g_n = p_n+1 - p_n . We have g_1 = 1, g_2 = g_3 = 2, and g_4 = 4." It can be proven that there are arbitrary large gaps, usually by showing that "in the sequence n!+2, n!+3, ..., n!+n the first term is divisible by 2, the second term is divisible by 3, and so on. Thus, this is a sequence of n-1 consecutive composite integers, and it must belong to a gap between primes having length at least n.", see ~ prmgap . Instead of using the factorial of n (see ~ df-fac ), any function can be chosen for which f(n) is not relatively prime to the integers 2, 3, ..., n. For example, the least common multiple of the integers 2, 3, ..., n, see ~ prmgaplcm , or the primorial n# (the product of all prime numbers less than or equal to n), see ~ prmgapprmo , are such functions, which provide smaller values than the factorial function (see ~ lcmflefac and ~ prmolefac resp. ~ prmolelcmf ): "For instance, the first prime gap of size larger than 14 occurs between the primes 523 and 541, while 15! is the vastly larger number 1307674368000." But the least common multiple of the integers 2, 3, ..., 15 is 360360, and 15# is 30030 (p_3248 = 30029 and P_3249 = 30047, so g_3248 = 18).

blocks.name: prmgaplem1
blocks.content: Lemma for ~ prmgap : The factorial of a number plus an integer greater than 1 and less then or equal to the number is divisible by that integer. (Contributed by AV, 13-Aug-2020.)
blocks.origin:
thm prmgaplem1(class c0, class c1) {
  |- wi(wa(wcel(c0, cn), wcel(c1, co(nat2, cfz, c0))), wbr(c1, cdvds, co(cfv(cfa, c0), caddc, c1)))
} = {
  mp2and(wa(wcel(c0, cn), wcel(c1, co(nat2, cfz, c0))), wbr(c1, cdvds, co(cfv(cfa, c0), caddc, c1)), wbr(c1, cdvds, cfv(cfa, c0)), wbr(c1, cdvds, c1))
  syl(wa(wcel(c0, cn), wcel(c1, co(nat2, cfz, c0))), wbr(c1, cdvds, cfv(cfa, c0)), wa(wcel(c1, cn), wcel(c0, cfv(cuz, c1))))
  adantl(wcel(c0, cn), wcel(c1, co(nat2, cfz, c0)), wa(wcel(c1, cn), wcel(c0, cfv(cuz, c1))))
  jca(wcel(c1, co(nat2, cfz, c0)), wcel(c1, cn), wcel(c0, cfv(cuz, c1)))
  syl(wcel(c1, co(nat2, cfz, c0)), wcel(c1, cn), wcel(c1, cfv(cuz, nat2)))
  elfzuz(c1, nat2, c0)
  eluz2nn(c1)
  elfzuz3(c1, nat2, c0)
  dvdsfac(c1, c0)
  adantl(wcel(c0, cn), wcel(c1, co(nat2, cfz, c0)), wbr(c1, cdvds, c1))
  syl(wcel(c1, co(nat2, cfz, c0)), wbr(c1, cdvds, c1), wcel(c1, cz))
  iddvds(c1)
  syl3anc(wa(wcel(c0, cn), wcel(c1, co(nat2, cfz, c0))), wi(wa(wbr(c1, cdvds, cfv(cfa, c0)), wbr(c1, cdvds, c1)), wbr(c1, cdvds, co(cfv(cfa, c0), caddc, c1))), wcel(c1, cz), wcel(cfv(cfa, c0), cz), wcel(c1, cz))
  adantr(wcel(c0, cn), wcel(c1, co(nat2, cfz, c0)), wcel(cfv(cfa, c0), cz))

  dvds2add(c1, cfv(cfa, c0), c1)
}

  2eluzge1()
  fzss1(nat2, nat1, c0)
  adantl(wcel(c0, cn), wcel(c1, co(nat2, cfz, c0)), wbr(c1, cdvds, c1))

  pm3.2i(wss(co(nat1, cfz, c0), cz), wcel(co(nat1, cfz, c0), cfn))

  fzfi(nat1, c0)

blocks.name: prmgaplem5
blocks.content: Lemma for ~ prmgap : for each integer greater than 2 there is a smaller prime closest to this integer, i.e. there is a smaller prime and no other prime is between this prime and the integer. (Contributed by AV, 9-Aug-2020.)
blocks.origin:

blocks.name: prmgaplem6
blocks.content: Lemma for ~ prmgap : for each positive integer there is a greater prime closest to this integer, i.e. there is a greater prime and no other prime is between this prime and the integer. (Contributed by AV, 10-Aug-2020.)

blocks.name: prmgap
blocks.content: The prime gap theorem: for each positive integer there are (at least) two successive primes with a difference ("gap") at least as big as the given integer. (Contributed by AV, 13-Aug-2020.)
blocks.origin:
thm prmgap(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3) {
  |- wral(s0, cn, wrex(s1, cprime, wrex(s2, cprime, wa(wbr(cv(s0), cle, co(cv(s2), cmin, cv(s1))), wral(s3, co(co(cv(s1), caddc, nat1), cfzo, cv(s2)), wnel(cv(s3), cprime))))))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffss(s0, s2)
  -| diffss(s0, s3)
  -| diffss(s1, s2)
  -| diffss(s1, s3)
  -| diffss(s2, s3)
} = {
  rgen(s0, cn, wrex(s1, cprime, wrex(s2, cprime, wa(wbr(cv(s0), cle, co(cv(s2), cmin, cv(s1))), wral(s3, co(co(cv(s1), caddc, nat1), cfzo, cv(s2)), wnel(cv(s3), cprime))))))
  prmgaplem8(s1, s2, s3, hs0, cv(s0), cmpt(hs1, cn, cfv(cfa, cv(hs1))), wcel(cv(s0), cn))
  id(wcel(cv(s0), cn))
  a1i(wcel(cv(s0), cn), wcel(cmpt(hs1, cn, cfv(cfa, cv(hs1))), co(cn, cmap, cn)))
  facmapnn(hs1)
  ralrimiva(hs0, co(nat2, cfz, cv(s0)), wcel(cv(s0), cn), wbr(nat1, clt, co(co(cfv(cmpt(hs1, cn, cfv(cfa, cv(hs1))), cv(s0)), caddc, cv(hs0)), cgcd, cv(hs0))))
  breqtrrd(nat1, clt, co(co(cfv(cmpt(hs1, cn, cfv(cfa, cv(hs1))), cv(s0)), caddc, cv(hs0)), cgcd, cv(hs0)), co(co(cfv(cfa, cv(s0)), caddc, cv(hs0)), cgcd, cv(hs0)), wa(wcel(cv(s0), cn), wcel(cv(hs0), co(nat2, cfz, cv(s0)))))
  prmgaplem2(cv(s0), cv(hs0))
  oveq1d(co(cfv(cmpt(hs1, cn, cfv(cfa, cv(hs1))), cv(s0)), caddc, cv(hs0)), cgcd, cv(hs0), co(cfv(cfa, cv(s0)), caddc, cv(hs0)), wa(wcel(cv(s0), cn), wcel(cv(hs0), co(nat2, cfz, cv(s0)))))
  oveq1d(cfv(cmpt(hs1, cn, cfv(cfa, cv(hs1))), cv(s0)), caddc, cv(hs0), cfv(cfa, cv(s0)), wa(wcel(cv(s0), cn), wcel(cv(hs0), co(nat2, cfz, cv(s0)))))
  fvmptd(hs1, cmpt(hs1, cn, cfv(cfa, cv(hs1))), cv(s0), cfv(cfa, cv(s0)), cn, cfv(cfa, cv(hs1)), universe, wa(wcel(cv(s0), cn), wcel(cv(hs0), co(nat2, cfz, cv(s0)))))
  eqidd(cmpt(hs1, cn, cfv(cfa, cv(hs1))), wa(wcel(cv(s0), cn), wcel(cv(hs0), co(nat2, cfz, cv(s0)))))
  adantl(wa(wcel(cv(s0), cn), wcel(cv(hs0), co(nat2, cfz, cv(s0)))), wceq(cv(hs1), cv(s0)), wceq(cfv(cfa, cv(hs1)), cfv(cfa, cv(s0))))
  fveq2(cv(hs1), cv(s0), cfa)
  simpl(wcel(cv(s0), cn), wcel(cv(hs0), co(nat2, cfz, cv(s0))))
  fvexd(cfa, cv(s0), wa(wcel(cv(s0), cn), wcel(cv(hs0), co(nat2, cfz, cv(s0)))))
  diff.cmpt.s(s1, hs1, cn, cfv(cfa, cv(hs1)))
  diff.cfv.s(s1, cfa, cv(hs1))
  diff.cfa.s(s1)
  diff.cv.s(s1, hs1)
  diffss.ex(s1, hs1)

thm prmgap(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3) {
  ⊢ ∀(s0 ∈ ℕ, ∃(s1 ∈ Prime, ∃(s2 ∈ Prime,(s0[≤](s2[-]s1)∧ ∀(s3 ∈((s1[+]1)[..^]s2), s3 ∉ Prime)))))
  ⊣ d(s0, s1)
  ⊣ d(s0, s2)
  ⊣ d(s0, s3)
  ⊣ d(s1, s2)
  ⊣ d(s1, s3)
  ⊣ d(s2, s3)
} = {
  rgen(s0, cn, ∃(s1 ∈ Prime, ∃(s2 ∈ Prime,(s0[≤](s2[-]s1)∧ ∀(s3 ∈((s1[+]1)[..^]s2), s3 ∉ Prime)))))
  prmgaplem8(s1, s2, s3, hs0, s0, (hs1 ∈ ℕ ↦(! ` hs1)), s0 ∈ ℕ)
  id(s0 ∈ ℕ)
  a1i(s0 ∈ ℕ, (hs1 ∈ ℕ ↦(! ` hs1))∈(ℕ[↦]ℕ))
  facmapnn(hs1)
  ralrimiva(hs0, (2[...]s0), s0 ∈ ℕ, 1[<]((((hs1 ∈ ℕ ↦(! ` hs1))` s0)[+]hs0)[gcd]hs0))
  breqtrrd(nat1, clt, ((((hs1 ∈ ℕ ↦(! ` hs1))` s0)[+]hs0)[gcd]hs0), (((! ` s0)[+]hs0)[gcd]hs0), (s0 ∈ ℕ ∧ hs0 ∈(2[...]s0)))
  prmgaplem2(s0, hs0)
  oveq1d((((hs1 ∈ ℕ ↦(! ` hs1))` s0)[+]hs0), cgcd, hs0, ((! ` s0)[+]hs0), (s0 ∈ ℕ ∧ hs0 ∈(2[...]s0)))
  oveq1d(((hs1 ∈ ℕ ↦(! ` hs1))` s0), caddc, hs0, (! ` s0), (s0 ∈ ℕ ∧ hs0 ∈(2[...]s0)))
  fvmptd(hs1, (hs1 ∈ ℕ ↦(! ` hs1)), s0, (! ` s0), cn, (! ` hs1), universe, (s0 ∈ ℕ ∧ hs0 ∈(2[...]s0)))
  eqidd((hs1 ∈ ℕ ↦(! ` hs1)), (s0 ∈ ℕ ∧ hs0 ∈(2[...]s0)))
  adantl((s0 ∈ ℕ ∧ hs0 ∈(2[...]s0)), hs1 = s0, (! ` hs1)=(! ` s0))
  fveq2(hs1, s0, cfa)
  simpl(s0 ∈ ℕ, hs0 ∈(2[...]s0))
  fvexd(cfa, s0, (s0 ∈ ℕ ∧ hs0 ∈(2[...]s0)))
  diff.cmpt.s(s1, hs1, cn, (! ` hs1))
  diff.cfv.s(s1, cfa, hs1)
  diff.cfa.s(s1)
  diff.cv.s(s1, hs1)
  diffss.ex(s1, hs1)
  diff.hs1.s(s1)
  diff.cmpt.s(s2, hs1, cn, (! ` hs1))
  diff.cfv.s(s2, cfa, hs1)
  diff.cfa.s(s2)
  diff.cv.s(s2, hs1)
  diffss.ex(s2, hs1)
  diff.hs1.s(s2)
  diff.cmpt.s(s3, hs1, cn, (! ` hs1))
  diff.cfv.s(s3, cfa, hs1)
  diff.cfa.s(s3)
  diff.cv.s(s3, hs1)
  diffss.ex(s3, hs1)
  diff.hs1.s(s3)
  diff.hs0.c(s0)
  diff.hs0.c((hs1 ∈ ℕ ↦(! ` hs1)))
  diff.wcel.s(s1, s0, cn)
  diff.cv.s(s1, s0)
  diffss.ex(s1, s0)
  diff.cn.s(s1)
  diff.wcel.s(s2, s0, cn)
  diff.cv.s(s2, s0)
  diffss.ex(s2, s0)
  diff.cn.s(s2)
  diff.wcel.s(s3, s0, cn)
  diff.cv.s(s3, s0)
  diffss.ex(s3, s0)
  diff.cn.s(s3)
  diff.hs0.w(s0 ∈ ℕ)
  diff.hs1.c(s0)
  diff.hs1.c((! ` s0))
  diff.hs1.c(cn)
  diff.hs1.w((s0 ∈ ℕ ∧ hs0 ∈(2[...]s0)))
}

blocks.name: prmgaplcm
blocks.content: Alternate proof of ~ prmgap : in contrast to ~ prmgap , where the gap starts at n! , the factorial of n, the gap starts at the least common multiple of all positive integers less than or equal to n. (Contributed by AV, 13-Aug-2020.) (Revised by AV, 27-Aug-2020.) (Proof modification is discouraged.) (New usage is discouraged.)
blocks.origin:
thm prmgaplcm(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3) {

  -| diffss(s2, s3)

  breqtrrd(nat1, clt, co(co(cfv(cmpt(hs1, cn, cfv(clcmf, co(nat1, cfz, cv(hs1)))), cv(s0)), caddc, cv(hs0)), cgcd, cv(hs0)), co(co(cfv(clcmf, co(nat1, cfz, cv(s0))), caddc, cv(hs0)), cgcd, cv(hs0)), wa(wcel(cv(s0), cn), wcel(cv(hs0), co(nat2, cfz, cv(s0)))))
